intro: Astragalus neuquenensis, commonly known as the Neuquén milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Argentina. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Astragalus neuquenensis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria, which contributes to soil fertility.
